title.narrative: IFC Private Enterprise Partnership for Africa (PEP Africa) Trust Fund

description.narrative:
In July 2005, the IFC embarked on the Private Enterprise Partnership for Africa (PEP Africa) Program as a successor to the Africa Project Development Facility (APDF)with the aim of enhancing private sector development in Sub-Saharan Africa. The PEP Africa programme completed its first five-year cycle in june 2010. Denmark has supported the first cycle of the program with 28 mDKK.
A strategic Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), which governs the collaboration between Denmark and IFC, was signed in October 2010. It was agreed that the parties would cooperate within the following strategic areas: Sub-Saharan Africa, fragile States, Environment and Climate and Gender Equality.
With reference to the MOU, Denmark agreed to contibute 25 mDKK to fund IFC's advisory services in Zimbabwe, Somalia and South Sudan and activities within gender equality. The progam is named "FSC and gender".
With the aim of securing administrative synergy, it was agreed to finance the above-mentioned activities through the Denmark PEP Africa Holding Trust Fund
